problem_text:
(Well-known problem of A. I. Maltsev). Is it true that every locally nilpotent group is a homomorphic image of some torsion-free locally nilpotent group?
Editors’ comment: An affirmative answer is known for periodic groups (E. M. Levich, A. I. Tokarenko, Siberian Math. J., 11 (1970), 1033–1034) and for countable groups (N. S. Romanovski˘ı, Preprint, 1969).
B. I. Plotkin
